sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Cluniac Chronicle. Miscellanea
Chronica. Miscellanea
msDesc.p: Vellum, 195 149 , 7.8 x 6, ff. 1 + 99 + 1, several volumes. Cent. xiii and xiv.

Volume I: Double columns of 26 lines. Cent. xiii late, in something of a charter hand.
Volume II: Double columns of 26 lines, black hand of cent. xiii early; double columns of 30 lines. Cent. xiii-xiv; double columns of 31 lines; inserted on leaves left blank, in a hand of cent. xv-xvi, double columns of 31 lines; 38 lines to a page. Cent. xiv.
Volume III: 32 lines to a page. Cent. xiv ?.
Volume IV: Double columns of 44 lines. Cent. xiii late?.
The book may be from Much Wenlock: see later.
The flyleaves are from a service-book of cent. xi in a fine round hand, the text carefully erased.
On f. 1v in red chalk the name: hare.

On the flyleaves (xv-xvi):
a. Ten Commandments in verse.
Disce deum colere, etc.
b. Pallida luna pluit rubea ventum alba serenat nolo caueat monachos miles. tremo miles. nescio doctus sec. Rolandum brugge monachum.
c. De Buildwas Abbas die S. Michaelis de tumba fuit a visitatoribus suis depositus a. d. m. ccccc. xx. ao r. r. Henrici 12.
Earlier writing has been obliterated from this flyleaf.

msItem.head: Pope Nicholas II (?), Constitutions of the Cluniac Order

head.title: Constitutiones datae a Nicolao papa ordini Cluniacensi

msItem.incipit: Nicholaus episcopus seruus, etc. Abbati Clun. eiusque coabbatibus...Regis pacifici pacis opera diligentis
msItem.explicit: intendere valeamus. Dat. rate secundo Idus Sept. pontif. nostri anno secundo
msItem.ab: blank

ab.handNote: In a similar but not the same hand

msItem.incipit: Notandum quod ab orbe condito usque aduentum Bretonum in anglia sunt anni d cccc et xv
msItem.explicit: ergo ab origine mundi usque aduentum normannorum in anglia sunt anni vj cc lxv et est summa totalis
msItem.incipit: Anno ab incarnacione domini mo lxvj aduentus normannorum, etc.
msItem.ab: In lower margin: a very slightly later hand
Mo lxi (?) Incepit locus sancte Marie de carit. Stephani
Various added entries concerning Cluniacs and Reading Abbey
1088. Ob. dominus Girardus primus prior de car'
1089. Monachi Bermund' venerunt in angl.
1110 (original). fundata est Abbacia de Hagemon
1121. petrus prior cluniacensis et vii fratres cum eo rogatu regis H. venerunt apud Rading
1123. Hugo prior de sancto pancratio Rad' abb. efficitur. petrus prior clun. redit
1144 (original). puer willelmus crucifixus est a Judeis apud Nortwicum
1172 (original). Foundation of Wigmore
1180 (original). Transl. of S. Frideswide
1234 (original). Conuentus de Hagemon vestierunt nigra capa
The succession of Bps of Hereford is specially noted and also Welsh affairs
1276 original. Conbustio eccl. S. Cedde Salop cum medietate ville
1284. benedictus est Gilbertus de Campedene in Abbatem de Hagemon

1285. Added: Johannes tunc prior de Wenlak factus est prior de Lewes cui successit pater henr. de bono villario tunc prior de Bermundeseye et intrauit domum suam de Wenl. honorifice vigil. S. Nicholai
The entries for 1293-4 are much longer than the rest and are in one or two different hands
Ends
msItem.explicit: hoc eciam anno recessit rex Scocie a fidelitate et homagio domini Regis Anglie Regi ffrancie confederatus

ab.ref: Hardy III 243, 246 resembles the Chronicle of Wigmore (P. 291)

msItem.ab: There seems to be a primary connexion with Haughmond (Augustinian): the Cluniac additions would suit Wenlock. Both these are in Shropshire

msItem.incipit: Sacramenta ecclesie quot sunt. Septem. que. Baptisma, etc.
msItem.explicit: et eorum immitatione proficiat de die in diem et ad uitam eternam perueniat. Amen
msItem.ab: Examination of a penitent
msItem.incipit: Frater si peccasti in superbia extollens te corde
msItem.explicit: admoneat preterea ut uitet omnes occasiones peccandi. coreas. ludos. aleas. et huiusmodi
msItem.ab: ff. 51v-53v blank

msItem.incipit: Fertur fuisse quidam rex nobilis potens et diues qui habuit principes multos. comites. barones. milites. et clientes
msItem.ab: Story of bull with golden horns, and the full confession of Maurus to the king, followed by moralization, ending
msItem.explicit: per quem celi ardentes soluentur et elementa
msItem.ab: Printed by T. Wright, Latin Stories, Percy Society, vol. VIII, no. 1
blank

head.title: Sermo in Quid exivistis in deserto

msItem.incipit: Quid existis in deserto uidere. Gregorus ait super Ezechielem
msItem.explicit: sequitur effectus gloriosus. prestante domino nostro Ihesu Christo qui cum patre, etc.

msItem.rubric: Summa cum veneratione salutem dicit plurimam tuus litterarius tirunculus et novitius
msItem.incipit: Habet in manibus tua iam reuerenda paternitas nostro marte quidem conscripta milburge sanctissime signorum sanctitatisque quedam insignia
msItem.explicit: Valeat tua reuerenda paternitas ultra cornices viuax
msItem.rubric: De filio cuiusdam milburge fonte submerso
msItem.explicit: defendat nos ab eterna morte. Amen
msItem.ab: At bottom of f. 67r and at top of f. 67v
per rolandum brug and Hec Rolandus brugge
On f. 67v the conclusion

lg.l: Benedictus es domine qui adiuvisti me, etc.

msItem.ab: This last paragraph is the beginning of a new series of miracles or the like, not written
f. 68r-68v blank
The compilation is probably by Roland Brugge. St Milburga was buried at Wenlock
Referred to in Hardy I 275

head.title: Sermo in Angelus Domini ascendit de Galgala

msItem.ab: At top, in red (xvi): Dan Rolande Brugge
msItem.incipit: Angelus domini ascendit de galgala Judic. 2. Cum ista sacra sollempnitas dominice ascensionis

msItem.head: Richard of Saint-Victor OSA, Liber exceptionum, part 2, book 1, ch. 1-4
msItem.ab: Beginning of Allegoriae Petri Comestoris
Ends unfinished

msItem.head: Innocent III (Lotharius de Segnis), De miseria humanae conditionis

head.title: Tractatus domini papae Innocentii III. de contemptu mundi

msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus domini pape Innocencii tercii de contemptu mundi
msItem.incipit: Domino patri ... petro dei gratia portuensi episcopo lotharius, etc.
msItem.ab: (P. L. CCXVII 701)

msItem.incipit: Liber iste dicitur liber ymnorum et ymnus est laus dei
msItem.ab: Ends with Ut queant laxis
msItem.explicit: ueniam i. indulgenciam per te redemptis. Amen

head.title: Sermons for Rogations, Ascension, Whitsunday, John Baptist, Assumption
Fragment of a collection of Sermons

msItem.ab: Those which remain are for Rogations, Ascension, Whitsunday, John Baptist, Assumption
On f. 99r are two sermons or parts of sermons in another hand
1. Vado ad eum qui me misit, etc.
2. De omnibus sanctis. Legimus in historiis sanctorum patrum fratres mei quad sanctus bonefacius qui quartus fuit a beato gregorio
